intro: Perama sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered perama, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Perama sparsiflora is typically found in heathlands and dry open forests, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
